landing.text:
Hello, I'm Hugo a Possibilities Scientist working in the intersection of development and design.

Experimenting and learning with the new and the traditional to create original expereriences and solve problems of our time.

about.title: About
about.part1: This year I decided to deepen my connection with technology and recently concluded a Full-Stack certification course of 2.000 hours, in which I experienced many aspects of a real professional environment, developing with deadlines, agile methodology, working with and managing teams, and also as a coach for peers.
about.part2: As is characteristic of the tech field, I still have things to learn about, but since we were introduced to new techs and concepts bimonthly in the course, I developed my capacity to learn quickly. As a ‘scientist’ I’m motivated by experimenting and learning with the new and the traditional to figure out the best ways to achieve goals and solve problems.
about.part3: And since learning became a habit I’m still studying in other courses and books to learn other programming languages and deepen some concepts like TDD (test driven development), common algorithms, data structures, and design patterns.

color.title: Color me... uncertain
color.description: A color matching game, developed with HTML5, vanilla JavaScript and CSS3, to practice what I had learned at the time about these technologies. Although it started as a game, as it evolved I came to look at this project as a piece of generative art, that happens to have a rounds and points system.

bwlgari.title: Bwlgari
bwlgari.description: The project that capped the first course module at Kenzie Academy Brasil, using HTML5, vanilla JavaScript and CSS3, I createad an one page e-commerce with layered filters, cart, and wish-list with products by the brand BVLGARI.

genius.title: GENIUS
genius.description: A great project to sharpen our logic, in this one the taks was to reproduce the game genius, but as I like to experiment with the possibilities went a bit further and created a point system and two more difficulty levels in which the player gets more points per round but the sequence is played gradually fester.

oregon.title: Oregon Trail
oregon.description: This project was the first one were I applyed the Object Oriented Programming paradigm with JavaScript, it is another I took a bit further, I decided to represent visually what was happening with the classes and methods, and so I did using HTML5 via DOM manipulation with JavaScript and CSS3.

products.title: Products List
products.description: Another e-commerce project, this one went through three iterations, the first in which we just listed the items, the second where we added the cart, and a third in which I converted the whole project the object oriented programming paradigm. As I tend to do, this one I took one step further improving on the CSS.

music.title: Kenzie Music
music.description: This project was very fun to do, was my first contact with APIs and asynchronicity, so naturally I got excited and instead of just creating a search bar for the music titles, I developed a simple playlist where the user could add, remove (to another list) and delete the searched music.

blog.title: Community Blog
blog.description: This project was great to learn more about and practice form validation and API integration. It was developed with vanilla JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3, and in it the task was to create a community blog in which only registered users could post, and only the owner could edit or delete a post.

reproduction.title: Layout Reproduction
reproduction.description: On this project the challenge was to reproduce a very well known layout (Netflix) using only vanilla Javascript, HTML5 and CSS3. I enjoyed doing this one because I’ve always seen people doing it but never did it myself. By the end it was very apparent why people do it, I’ve learned a lot!

food.title: Kenzie Food
food.description: This was a team project, in which I had the opportunity to be the Tech Leader following the agile methodology. On this one our team was taked to create a food e-commerce applying the content of the module: API, OOP, LocalStorage, Mobile First. Using vanilla JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3.

nu.title: Nu Kenzie
nu.description: A interesting project, was one of the first I developed using React and it’s states, it has two iterations, one without and another with the Styled Components lib. On this one the application simulates a digital wallet in which the user can register their expenses and profits.

burguer.title: Kenzie Burguer
burguer.description: With this project I practiced the use of API with React, learning more about react hooks, and the Axios lib. In this one I also experimented more with the Styled Components lib to create a light and a dark theme changed by the user. In it we created a fast-food e-commerce with products from an API.

form.title: Form Practice
form.description: I went a bit experimental on this one, the project was designed for us to prectice with forms and form validation in React, using external libs, but as I often do, I took it futher and played a bit with the Framer Motion lib to create an “realxig experience” for the registered users.

hub.title: Kenzie Hub
hub.description: On this project the objective was to integrate to practices we had in other projects, forms and API in a single React project. The application then simulates a platform in which a user can check out the tech stack and level of other devs, and also register themselves and their tech stack.

redux.title: Kenzieshop - Redux
redux.description: On this project I had “carte blache” to pick a theme for the e-commerce, so I decided to revisit the project I did for the conclusion of my first module in the course, and refactor it now using React, Reudx, w/ Thunk as middleware, and Styled Components.

context.title: Kenzieshop - Context
context.description: This project is actually the second iteration of another one in which I used Redux w/ Thunk to create a e-commerce, but I ended up not only changing the state management to React’s Context API but also the theme of the store.

relativi.title: Relativi
relativi.description: Another team project, in this one I had the opportunity to act as Product Owner following the agile methodology. Our team decided to create an health & wellness application, that could benefit not only the user but also service providers, with a platform to register and search for physical activities, using React, Redux, Styled Components, Axios, and JSON-Server to simulate a database hosted in Heroku.

relativi-back.title: Relativi Backend
relativi-back.description: A team project, in this one I had the opportunity to act as Tech Leader following the agile methodology. Our team decided to create a REST API for a health & wellness application, using Node, Express, TypeORM, PostgreSQL, and Docker.

gdc-api.title: GDC API
gdc-api.description: One more team project, in this one I had the opportunity to act as Product Owner following the agile methodology. Our team decided to create a REST API for a job-applications management tool, using Python, Django Rest Framework, and PostgreSQL.

pokedex-vue.title: Vue.js Pokédex
pokedex-vue.description: A project that uses the PokeAPI to create a tool to search Pokémons and their evolutions rendering info and attributes of each pokémon found. I used Vue.js for the first time with TypeScript and Scss

ng-cash.title: NG Cash
ng-cash.description: The idea was to develop an app in which users could register with and username and password, and with an authentication could make “Cash-outs”: transactions that would send a value to other user by their username. As well as visualize and filter the transactions that they participated in.On this project I used Jest, Supertest and Sqlite3 for the unit and integration tests, PostgreSQL for the database, Node, Express, TypeScript and typeORM for the backend, React, Context API, Styled-Components and TypeScript for the frontend and Docker to orchestrate it all.

linkedin.title: LinkedIn
linkedin.text: Where I share most of my projects and experiments, so feel free to follow my journey, discover more about projects, or just chat.

github.title: GitHub
github.text: Find repositories of projects listed here and projects in progress or in huatus.

resume.title: Resumé
resume.text: Download the latest version of my resumé.

whats.title: WhatsApp
whats.text: Click to start a chat, voice or video call via WhatsApp.

telegram.title: Telegram
telegram.text: Click to start a chat, voice or video call, or search for hblerdev in Telegram.

email.title: Email
email.text: Have a feedback, idea, or a proposal? Email me, and we’ll keep in touch.
